reasoning_trace.value: The paper presents a THz photonic-based ISAC system for fiber-wireless networks, achieving a range resolution of 6 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s.
The system uses a thin-film lithium niobate Mach-Zehnder modulator (TFLN-MZM) for full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of D-band LFM echo signals.
The system achieves a calibrated mean ranging error of less than 3 mm and a peak data rate of 116 Gbit/s at a center frequency of 134 GHz.
The system demonstrates exceptional performance, positioning it at the forefront of photonic-based THz ISAC technology.

bibliographic.value: THz Integrated Sensing and Communication With Full-Photonic Direct LFM Reception and De-Chirping for D-Band Fiber-Wireless Network
Boyu Dong, Zhongya Li, Sizhe Xing, Yinjun Liu, Junhao Zhao, Ouhan Huang, Junlian Jia, Jianyang Shi, Yingjun Zhou, Haipeng Wang, Nan Chi, Junwen Zhang
IEEE Transactions on Microwave Theory and Techniques

key_contribution.value: Full-photonic direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM echo signals
Direct reception and de-chirping of THz LFM echo signals
